newsitem.title: UK: Pegasus has withdrawn from Sage talks.
newsitem.headline: Pegasus has withdrawn from Sage talks.

text.p: Accounting software firm Pegasus Group Plc said on Wednesday that it had withdrawn from talks with Sage Group Plc about a possible conditional offer.

Pegasus said it felt Sage's increased offer of 475 pence per share, undervalued its "excellent medium term trading prospects and the significant benefits which would accrue to Sage from a combination of the two businesses."

Pegasus said it thought an acquisition would be referred to the competition watchdog the Monopolies and Mergers Commission and that "there is a high probability that the takeover would be subsequently blocked."
Such uncertainty would undermine the company in customers' eyes and could hit sales, it said.
It said its outlook as an independent company was "excellent" and offered "significant revenue growth" in future.
